{{Infobox organization |name = FriendsWithYou |image = File:FWY Sam and Tury.jpg |image_border = |size = |alt = |caption = Samuel Albert Borkson and Arturo Sandoval III |map = |msize = |malt = |mcaption = |abbreviation = |motto = Magic, Luck, and Friendship! |formation = 2002 |extinction = |type = [[Sculpture]], experimental art, [[installation art]], [[performance art]], [[public art]], [[animation]], spiritual engineering |status = |purpose = |headquarters = |location = |coords = |region_served = |membership = |language = |leader_title = |leader_name = |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = {{URL|http://www.friendswithyou.com}} |remarks = }}
'''FriendsWithYou''' (FWY) is an art collaborative based in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]],<ref name="Inside FriendsWithYou's Incredible Los Angeles Studio">{{Cite web |url= http://www.complexmag.ca/art-design/2013/04/inside-friendswithyous-incredible-los-angeles-studio|publisher= Complex Magazine|title= Inside FriendsWithYou's Incredible Los Angeles Studio |accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> founded in Miami, [[Florida]], by Samuel Albert Borkson (b.1979, Plantation, Florida)<ref name="Biography">{{Cite web |url= http://friendswithyou.com/info/biography/|publisher= FriendsWithYou|title= Biography|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> and Arturo Sandoval III (b. 1976, Havana, Cuba) <ref name="Biography"/> in 2002, which seeks to redesign [[spirituality]], rituals, and religious acts for modern day usage and connectivity.<ref name="FRIENDSWITHYOU">{{Cite web |url= http://theholenyc.com/2011/06/10/friendwithyou|publisher= The Hole|title= FRIENDSWITHYOU |accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> FriendsWithYou’s mission coincides with their motto "Magic, Luck, and Friendship."<ref name="FriendsWithYou's 'Inner Space': Art After Basel">{{Cite news |url= http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/12/15/friendswithyou-inner-space_n_1151062.html|publisher= The Huffington Post|title= FriendsWithYou's 'Inner Space': Art After Basel|accessdate=July 12, 2013|first=Amanda|last=McCorquodale|date=December 15, 2011}}</ref>
The collaborative began by creating soft sculptures as a means to spread more accessible art like plush and wood toys,<ref name="Friends With YOU in NYC">{{Cite web |url= http://textileartscenterblog.com/friends-with-you-in-nyc/|publisher= Textile Arts Center|title= Friends With YOU in NYC|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> as well as immersive art installations, fine art works including sculpture and painting, and are best known for their public art spectacles such as large-scale art installations, playgrounds, and performance pieces.<ref name="Friends With You opens its Design District Studio for Art Basel Exhibition called “Inner Space, the Secrets of the Unknown">{{Cite web |url= http://the305.com/2011/11/25/friends-with-you-opens-its-design-district-studio-for-art-basel-exhibition-called-inner-space-the-secrets-of-the-unknown/#ixzz2TzX4Br6B|publisher= The305.com|title= Friends With You opens its Design District Studio for Art Basel Exhibition called "Inner Space, the Secrets of the Unknown |accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> They have described the creation of their art as a healing process intended to increase relatability and connection to each other and the world around them.<ref name="Interview: FriendsWithYou Discusses Their Artists Talk with MOCAtv and the Art of Positivity">{{Cite web |url= http://www.complex.com/art-design/2013/02/interview-friendswithyou-discusses-their-artists-talk-with-mocatv-and-the-art-of-positivity|publisher= Complex Magazine|title= Interview: FriendsWithYou Discusses Their Artists Talk with MOCAtv and the Art of Positivity|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> To date, they have become internationally recognized with public exhibits and artworks in Europe, Asia, Australia, and The Americas.
FriendsWithYou Fine Art has been exhibited and/or included in the permanent collections of [[Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles|Museum of Contemporary Art]] (MOCA), the [[Indianapolis Museum of Art]] (IMA), [[Haus der Kulturen der Welt|Haus der Kulturen der Welt Museum Berlin]], and [[Galerie Perrotin|Galerie Emmanuel Perrotin]] among others.<ref name="Magic, Luck and Friendship (TM)">{{Cite web |url= http://sites.moca.org/thecurve/2013/02/15/magic-luck-and-friendship/ |publisher= Complex Magazine|title= Magic, Luck and Friendship (TM)|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> In October 2006, the [[Germany|German]] art press Die Gestalten Verlag published a FriendsWithYou [[monograph]] titled ''Friends With You Have Powers!''
==Evaluation and influence== FriendsWithYou have explained that their art is meant to "activate the social interaction of people as exploded and refracted by the Internet and elaborate new modes of interpersonal relationships."<ref name="FRIENDSWITHYOU"/>
They use play as an artistic means to foster these relationships.<ref name="Artists: FriendsWithYou">{{Cite web | url= http://iloveoffset.com/stage/friendswithyou |publisher= iloveoffset.com |title= FriendsWithYou |accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> Many FriendsWithYou works look like toys because they are meant for play as a means of interactive unstructured free association. FWY hopes that "through their artwork, the buried, neglected urges and yearnings that a seasoned art viewer may not expect to have activated; playfulness, laughter and inquisitiveness are triggered, with an end result of feeling connected."<ref name="Artists Statement">{{Cite web | url= http://friendswithyou.com/info|publisher= FriendsWithYou|title= Artists Statement|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
FWY inverts the practice and usage of religious traditions, symbols, and spiritual practices through play to open a connection to the divine.<ref name="FRIENDSWITHYOU"/><ref name="Interview: FriendsWithYou Discusses Their Artists Talk with MOCAtv and the Art of Positivity"/>
Conceptually, FriendsWithYou’s experiential artwork is in conversation with [[Relational Aesthetics]] and the work of Jeff Koons, [[Takashi Murakami]], and [[Damien Hirst]]. The collective has been compared to Takashi Murakami for their "[[superflat]]" approach to art.<ref name="Friends With You">{{Cite web |url= http://www.broadsheet.com.au/sydney/arts-and-entertainment/article/friends-you|publisher= Broadsheet|title= Friends With You|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
==Artwork and installations== ===Solo shows=== '''Inner Vision in Between''' was featured at the MCLEMOI Gallery in Sydney, Australia from February 15 to April 11, 2013. The exhibition themes ran from the playful to the spiritual. It was also described as a minimal, peaceful, stoic and occasionally foreboding journey from one chapter to another.<ref name="Inner Vision In Between"/>
'''In The Beginning''', featured at the Colette in Paris from August 29 to September 24, 2011. It consisted of bronze sculptures, a series of prints, including two exclusive edition prints solely for Colette, an animation video piece and limited run products, in addition to limited edition inflatable Malfi heads and Rainbow Mr. TTT bop bags.<ref name="IN THE BEGINNING"/>
''''Happy Rainbow''', installed at the Tuen Mun Town Plaza, in Hong Kong from July 22 to September 2, 2012 was a colorful interactive bounce house which also featured fiberglass, plush and resin sculpture installations.<ref name="Happy Rainbow – Friends With You">{{Cite web |url= http://www.myplasticblog.com/art-shows/happy-rainbow-fwy/|publisher= myplasticblog.com|title= Happy Rainbow – FriendsWithYou|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref><ref name="Happy Rainbow – Friends With You"/><ref name="Friends With You ‘Happy Rainbow’ Exhibition in Hong Kong">{{Cite web |url= http://www.acclaimmag.com/arts/friends-with-you-happy-rainbow-exhibition-in-hong-kong/|publisher= Acclaim Magazine|title= Friends With You ‘Happy Rainbow’ Exhibition in Hong Kong|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> FWY designed the installation as a modern shrine which also embodies their themes of play and spirituality. "FWY hopes to evoke a spiritual connectivity that will enlighten all visitors. Each piece in the exhibition is charged with so much color and power that it brings great harmony to all who look upon it," the group wrote.<ref name="Happy Rainbow">{{Cite web |url= http://friendswithyou.com/portfolio/fwys-first-hong-kong-exhibition-happy-rainbow|publisher= FriendsWithYou|title= Happy Rainbow|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref><ref name="Friendswithyou Blows Up Happy Rainbow In Hong Kong">{{Cite web |url= http://knstrct.com/2012/08/13/friendswithyou-blows-up-happy-rainbow-in-hong-kong|publisher= knstrct.com|title= Friendswithyou Blows Up Happy Rainbow In Hong Kong|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
''':)''' at the Hole from June 10 to August 6, 2011 <ref name="Biography"/> was FriendsWithYou’s first solo exhibition in New York and the inaugural show at the Hole’s new location. The show featured 22 FriendsWithYou artworks including a series of anthropomorphic figures created largely out of geometric abstractions made from Lasercut MDF, car paint and acrylic. The show was described as "relentlessly cheerful," and “an interactive, experiential wonderland of pop-straction and participation.” Much like Murakami, [[Arturo Herrera]], [[Yayoi Kusama]], and others FWY take a spiritual and serene approach to form and figure in the :) exhibition. The artists consider these works to be part of the “service art” movement, allowing for the viewer to easily understand their message and not be categorized as “pretentious art”. FWY feels art is for everyone and can aid in connecting humankind.<ref name="Building a Rainbow City">{{Cite web |url= http://friendswithyou.com/portfolio/inner-space-the-secrets-of-the-unknown| publisher= Artlog|title= Building a Rainbow City|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
'''Inner Space, The Secrets of the Unknown''' featured bright wooden sculptures, introspective metal beings and FriendsWithYou's signature inflatable artwork. The installation ran at The Hole NYC annex in Miami from December 1, 2011 to January 28, 2012.<ref name="FriendsWithYou's 'Inner Space': Art After Basel"/><ref name="Friends With You opens its Design District Studio for Art Basel Exhibition called “Inner Space, the Secrets of the Unknown"/> FWY explained that “the pieces on display are figurative self reflective treasures, levitating in a space continuum, revealing something otherwise inaccessible."<ref name="FriendsWithYou's 'Inner Space': Art After Basel"/><ref name="Friendswithyou At Art Basel Miami 2011">{{Cite web |url= http://knstrct.com/2011/12/04/friendswithyou-at-art-basel-miami-2011/|publisher= knstrct.com|title= Friendswithyou At Art Basel Miami 2011|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref><ref name="INNER SPACE , THE SECRETS OF THE UNKNOWN">{{Cite web |url= http://friendswithyou.com/portfolio/inner-space-the-secrets-of-the-unknown|publisher= FriendsWithYou|title= INNER SPACE , THE SECRETS OF THE UNKNOWN|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
'''Building Blocks''', featured at Art Basel in Miami from December 2, 2010 to January 8, 2011, featured FriendsWithYou's trademark playful inflatables as well as prints.<ref name="BUILDING BLOCKS">{{Cite web |url= http://friendswithyou.com/portfolio/building-blocks/|publisher= FriendsWithYou|title= BUILDING BLOCKS|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> The installation consisted of paintings created over the course of a decade. The paintings were meant to be flat extensions of FriendsWithYou's existing sculptural, graphical and experiential installation works and were created to allow or encourage viewers to project their own emotions onto.. The pieces were presented alongside the series of paintings, FWY exhibited select sculptural pieces, meant to illustrate the progression between their installation and the “portraiture.”<ref name="BUILDING BLOCKS"/><ref name="FriendsWithYou Building Blocks Opening Reception">{{Cite web |url= http://www.soflanights.com/?p=2502|publisher= soflanights.com|title= FriendsWithYou Building Blocks Opening Reception|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
{{anchor|Rainbow City}} '''Rainbow City''' was an interactive installation containing minimalist inflatable forms from 8' to 50' borrowing their aesthetics from toy-like geometries and designs.<ref name="AOL Artists: Rainbow City">{{Cite web |url= http://www.aolartists.com/initiatives/rainbow-city|publisher= AOL Artists|title= Rainbow City|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> Originally commissioned in 2010 by the Luminato Arts Foundation in Toronto, Canada, Rainbow City was then exhibited at Art Basel Miami 2010 presented by Paper Magazine, Pharrell Williams, and Aol. About 20,000 people visited the installation and were able to participate by bouncing about inside the inflatable structures and wandering in and around the surreal landscape.<ref name="FriendsWithYou Converts Art Basel 2010 Into A Rainbow City">{{Cite web |url= http://thecreatorsproject.vice.com/blog/friendswithyou-converts-art-basel-2010-into-a-rainbow-city |publisher= The Creators Project|title= FriendsWithYou Converts Art Basel 2010 Into A Rainbow City |accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> On June 6, 2010 to open section 2 of the High Line in New York City, a collection of 40 air-filled sculptures filled 16,000 square feet of outdoor space in Chelsea.<ref name="FriendsWithYou's Rainbow City at the High Line Park"/> It was FWY's first large scale interactive installation in New York City.<ref name="RAINBOW CITY: AOL & FRIENDSWITHYOU'S URBAN PLAYGROUND">{{Cite web |url= http://www.psfk.com/2011/05/rainbow-city-aol-friendswithyous-urban-playground.html|publisher= psfk|title= RAINBOW CITY: AOL & FRIENDSWITHYOU'S URBAN PLAYGROUND|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref><ref name="ART COLLECTIVE FRIENDSWITHYOU BRING COLOR AND JOY TO NEW YORK">{{Cite web |url= http://culturereport.wordpress.com/2011/06/21/art-collective-friendswithyou-bring-color-and-joy-to-new-york|publisher= The Culture Report|title= ART COLLECTIVE FRIENDSWITHYOU BRING COLOR AND JOY TO NEW YORK|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> According to the artists, Rainbow City was created to allow the viewer to reinterpret spirituality. The large totems represented self-reflective portraits, in line with FWY’s goal of evoking visitors to see their emotions and own self within the sculptural pieces. Visitors were encouraged to come and “be in awe of these large, reduced shaped and simple totems,” stated Arturo Sandoval III. By evoking play through very simple form, FriendsWithYou feels an almost religious scenario of connectivity is created in this interactive installation.<ref name="ART COLLECTIVE FRIENDSWITHYOU BRING COLOR AND JOY TO NEW YORK"/><ref name="Friends with Safewalls">{{Cite web |url= http://www.safewalls.org/news/friendswithsafewalls/|publisher= Safewalls|title= Friends with Safewalls |accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
'''The Fun House''', described as "a giant, anthropomorphic bounce house intended to help unleash the visitors’ inner brats and in doing so, take advantage of the healing power of fun,<ref name="Friends With You - Miami">{{Cite web |url= http://www.thecoolhunter.net/article/detail/1446 |publisher= The Cool Hunter|title= Friends With You - Miami|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>" was originally commissioned by 944 magazine and the Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas in 2008. It grew as the installation traveled around the world.<ref name="Fun House">{{Cite web |url= http://friendswithyou.com/portfolio/fun-house/|publisher= FriendsWithYou|title= Fun House|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> As a part of Art Basel Miami 2008 FriendsWithYou was the main featured artist at the Scope Art Fair. Their Fun House installation (December 3rd to December 7th) <ref name="Biography"/> featured a large bounce house with a smiling face design, filled with inflatable balls, a bounce house, a romper room, restaurant, and a FWY store and fine art gallery.<ref name="FriendsWithYou's Rainbow City at the High Line Park">{{Cite web |url= http://flavorwire.com/183480/friendswithyous-rainbow-city-at-the-high-line-park|publisher= flavorwire|title= FriendsWithYou's Rainbow City at the High Line Park|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> It was also installed at the Welt Museum in Berlin from March 19th to May 3rd, 2009.<ref name="Biography"/><ref name="Fun House"/> and the Nada Art Fair, New York.<ref name="Fun House"/><ref name="Pictoplasma: Fun House">{{Cite web |url= http://portfolio.pictoplasma.com/2009/05/12/fun-house|publisher= Pictoplasma|title= Fun House|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
'''Dream Maker''' was an installation of rotating spherical objects with faces similar to a miniature solar system. It was up at the [[Indianapolis Museum of Art]] from May 2, 2008 to November 9, 2008.<ref name="Pixelsumo - Friends With You"/><ref name="Floating Sculptures and Cascading Rope Installations to Ocuppy IMA's Efroymson Pavilion">{{Cite web |url= http://artdaily.org/index.asp?int_sec=2&int_new=24723&b=minimalism#.Ubuck_ZAT_I|publisher= artdaily.org|title= Floating Sculptures and Cascading Rope Installations to Ocuppy IMA's Efroymson Pavilion|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
<!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:RainbowValleyFWY.jpg|thumb|left|'''Rainbow Valley''', a playground designed by FriendsWithYou at the [[Aventura Mall]] in [[Miami]]]] -->'''Rainbow Valley''' is a playground designed by FriendsWithYou located at the Aventura Mall in Miami. It was commissioned as a part of the mall’s “Turnberry for the Arts” program, which was founded to help promote the arts by “displaying world class artwork created by both celebrated contemporary artists and talented local artists in Aventura and the surrounding Miami area.” Other artists in the collection include: Daniel Arsham, Louise Bourgeois, Julian Opie, Tom Otterness, Gary Hume, Lawrence Weiner and Jorge Pardo<ref name="The amazing art of Aventura Mall">{{Cite web |url= http://cityofaventurablog.com/2012/07/23/the-amazing-art-of-aventura-mall/|publisher= cityofaventurablog.com|title= The amazing art of Aventura Mall|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> It opened on December 21, 2006 and was their first permanent installation. The playground has rainbow bridges, slides, a control center, crawl-in mountains in bright colors and the entire area is foam-covered.<ref name="IN THE BEGINNING">{{Cite web |url= http://friendswithyou.com/portfolio/in-the-beginning-by-fwy-colette-paris/|publisher= FriendsWithYou|title= IN THE BEGINNING|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> The installation was meant to foster creativity in children through its interactivity though a storyline of a small mountain, who loses his family, on a search for other mountains to play with.<ref name="Pixelsumo - Friends With You">{{Cite web |url= http://www.pixelsumo.com/post/friends-with-you|publisher= pixelsumo|title= Friends With You|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> "The playground will guide children through Peeko, the baby mountain, and his adventure with Cloudy, his new found friend, to the magical Rainbow Valley."<ref name="Rainbow Valley Playground">{{Cite web |url= http://www.aventuramall.com/kids-club/rainbow-valley.html/|publisher= aventuramall.com|title= Rainbow Valley Playground|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> Wired described it as "a warped Mario Bros. level"
[[File:FriendsWithYou's Cloud City 3.jpg|thumb|right|'''Cloud City''']]'''Cloud City''' opened in 2005 at the MOCA warehouse during the annual Art Basel in Miami. It was set up as an interactive playground composed of geometric shapes such inflatable spheres, padded 10 foot cones on casters, and pillowed cylinders. The oversized geometric forms and colors invited participation on the part of the viewers in Cloud City, "an adventurous dream world playground designed to reinvigorate audiences with childlike energy and optimism."<ref name="Friends With You Cloud City Exhibition">{{Cite web |url= http://news.gestalten.com/news/friends-you-cloud-city-exhibition|publisher= gestalten|title= Friends With You Cloud City Exhibition|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> Several of the objects replicated the facial design of their character The boy. The central figure in this installation, The boy is an archetype that embodies youth and naïve creation.<ref name="FRIENDS WITH YOU: CLOUD CITY">{{Cite web |url= http://mocanomi.org/2005/07/friends-with-you/|publisher= mocanomi.org|title= FRIENDS WITH YOU: CLOUD CITY |accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>). With the start of Cloud City FriendsWithYou also released a CD music album of the same name featuring music artists such as PonPoko, Phoenicia, Otto VaN Shirach, and Sam.
'''Cloudy''' is a video installation that launched exclusively on "'[[Pharrell Williams]]'"'s "'[[i am OTHER]]'" "'[[YouTube]]'" channel. "Cloudy" is a short by artists Samuel Borkson and Arturo Sandoval III. The animated piece is an exploration into the clouds; a sweet, visual soundscape that takes the viewer through a personal journey into the sky. It invites viewers to follow a cast of clouds and raindrops through an entrancing adventure. FriendsWithYou explores animism, giving the main cast of characters a soul. The purpose of the piece is to transcend the viewer to a peaceful and joyous state. Clouds singing and performing their duties in a joyful manner show us that everything in our world has a role and a purpose.<ref name="CLOUDY">{{cite web |url= https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kySziocrOmU |author1 =Samuel Borkson |author2 =Arturo Sandoval III |title= Friends With You - Cloudy |date =18 July 2012 |website =YouTube |accessdate =23 January 2018}}</ref>
'''Skywalkers Parade''' was commissioned by Scion and was a collaboration with other artists such as Ara Peterson, [[Misaki Kawai]], MumbleBoy, Paper Rad, David Choe, and DEVILROBOTS.<ref name="Inner Vision In Between">{{Cite web |url= http://www.artwhatson.com.au/mclemoi/inner-vision-in-between|publisher= artwhatson.com.au|title= Inner Vision In Between |accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref><ref name="Happy Rainbow – Friends With You"/> It consisted of a number of balloons sizing from 5 feet to 60 feet and premiered on December 7, 2006 during Art Basel Miami. FWY conceived the Skywalkers Parade as “a collaborative way to tell a beautiful story through an enchanted parade in the sky.<ref name="SKYWALKERS parade">{{Cite web | url= http://www.artnexus.com/PressReleases_View.aspx?DocumentID=17015|publisher= Art Nexus|title= SKYWALKERS parade|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref><ref name="SKYWALKERS">{{Cite web |url= http://friendswithyou.com/portfolio/sky-walkers/|publisher= FriendsWiithYou|title= SKYWALKERS|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref><ref name="FRIENDSWITHYOU & THE SKYWALKERS PARADE">{{Cite web |url= http://www.onesmallseed.net/profiles/blogs/friendswithyou-amp-the|publisher= FriendsWiithYou|title= FRIENDSWITHYOU & THE SKYWALKERS PARADE|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>
'''Get Lucky''' was an installation located in the Miami based art space The Box which ran from August 28th to September 25th, 2004. It featured six different altars, with a focus on pyramid, conical, or triangular shapes, covering different aspects of human life and death. The Fur Liaison was a furry monster character who accompanied guests around the installation. The Installation aimed to be an "adventure into a modern ritual that empowers us to realize the significant effect we can pose on the world and a chance to alter it to a more balanced state to achieve happiness."<ref name="GET LUCKY INTERACTIVE INSTALLATION">{{Cite web | url= http://news.gestalten.com/news/get-lucky-interactive-installation |publisher= Gestalten|title= GET LUCKY INTERACTIVE INSTALLATION|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref> (It also was featured at the Merry Karnowsky Gallery in Los Angeles November 20, 2004 from January 15, 2005.)<ref name="GETLUCKY">{{Cite web |url= http://friendswithyou.com/portfolio/get-lucky|publisher= FriendsWiithYou|title= GET LUCKY|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>

==Characters and toys== <!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:GWGGroup.jpg|thumb|The ''Good Wood Gang'' from 2005]] --> FriendsWithYou refers to its toy-like characters as "friends."<ref name="Friends with Safewalls"/>
The friends include: * Malfi * Mr. TTT burger * The boy * Rainbow King
As one of their first projects, FWY created a soft sculptural toy line using their friends characters that was intended to empower collectors with interactive "pseudo-amulets" at an accessible price. Each toy or soft sculpture is produced in a small edition, typically not re-released, and given a persona described in a booklet-style tag affixed to it.<ref name="Friends">{{Cite web | url= http://friendswithyou.com/portfolio/plush/|publisher= FriendsWithYou|title= Friends|accessdate=July 12, 2013}}</ref>

The '''gripfid''' is an invention of knotting expert [[Stuart Grainger]].<ref>Stuart Grainger, Knotted Fabrics ({{ISBN|0-9530398-0-3}}), pages 71–74</ref> It is a small knotter's [[fid]] with an added "grip", a hollow shaft that ends near the point with a vee that acts as a jamming cleat. [[Image:Gripfid used in ply-split braiding.jpg|thumb|alt=|A '''Gripfid''' .|A ''Gripfid'' tool being used to pull a cord in ply-split braiding.]]
For [[ply-split braiding]] the point separates plies, and another cord is tucked into the hollow shaft of the gripfid and pulled back through the split cord. Although a [[latchhook]] may be used instead of a gripfid, the latter is much preferred.<ref>Peter Collingwood, "The Techniques of Ply-split Braiding" ({{ISBN|0-9625586-9-9}})</ref><ref>"Tools for Ply-split Braiding"https://www.louisefrench.com/techniques/techniques.html</ref><ref>"Making Gripfids" http://www.louisefrench.com/making_gripfids.htm</ref><ref>"How to Make a Gripfid for Ply-Splitting" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8e9-t9aXa6M</ref><ref>"Tools for Tablet Weaving and Ply-Splitting" http://www.lindahendrickson.com/tools.htm</ref>

Film is banned in Australia and Germany. == Plot == Unable to bring in anymore money for Leroy, her abusive pimp, the pregnant Rose tries to run away in the middle of the night, but is caught by Leroy. Using a clothes hanger, Leroy performs an impromptu abortion on Rose, unintentionally killing her in the process. Leroy disposes of Rose's baby in a dumpster, where its cries attract the attention of a homeless man, who raises the disfigured child as "Hanger". On his eighteenth birthday, the vagrant sends Hanger off to live with John, his biological father, who the man had earlier met at a junkyard. John informs Hanger that he has gotten him a job at the junkyard, and that he will be working there and living with Russell, an acquaintance with [[Down syndrome]]. As he drives away with Hanger, John runs over the homeless man (who was defecating in his tent) and joyously tells his long-lost son "Welcome to the rest of your life!" John gives Hanger a picture of Rose, and picks up a prostitute for him to have sex with, but upon seeing Hanger's mutilated face, the woman goes into hysterics, so John crushes her head in his truck door. While Hanger is watching pornography with Russell in their home, a [[Jehovah's Witnesses|Jehovah's Witness]] visits, and Hanger mauls and partially eats her while being cheered on by Russell. Later, John drops by, and reveals to Hanger that he has a plan to get revenge on Leroy for what he did to Rose. On his way out, John is approached by Foxy White, Leroy's girlfriend, who offers to help John kill Leroy. John turns down Foxy's offer, but says he will make Leroy suffer "a little extra" if Foxy watches over Hanger. While Hanger is at work, John is captured by Leroy and a prostitute named Trashy, who disfigure him with a [[blow torch]], and a hanger. Foxy finds John and tries to release him, but Leroy walks in on this, and shoots Foxy in the head. As that occurs, Russell and Hanger are drugged by Phil, a co-worker, who rapes them while wearing a [[Santa suit]]; at one point, Phil inserts his penis into Hanger's leaking [[colostomy]]. Russell and Hanger get their revenge on Phil at the junkyard, knocking him out, and placing him under a pile of garbage. Russell goes home and drinks tea made from used [[tampon]]s, but after getting a call from Hanger, Russell goes to the junkyard, and finds Nicole (the owner's daughter) unconscious in her office, Hanger having knocked her out with Phil's drugs. Russell takes Nicole's tampon, and she is later found by Leroy, who rapes her while she is unconscious, and threatens her into luring away Russell so Leroy can be alone with Hanger. Once he is in Nicole's office, Russell is seemingly killed by Leroy, who chokes him with one of Nicole's tampons. Outside, Hanger stomps Phil's head in, and is confronted by Leroy, but John (who was left for dead, but recovered and killed Trashy by shoving a [[douche]] up her nose) appears and calls Leroy out. {{use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{use Indian English|date=October 2018}} {{other uses}} {{italic title}} [[File:Tilla Jogian.jpg|thumb|right|250px|[[Tilla Jogian]], [[Pakistan]] where Ranjha came]] '''''Heer Ranjha''''' is one of several popular tragic romances of [[Punjab region|Punjab]]. The others are ''[[Mirza Sahiba]]'' and ''[[Sohni Mahiwal]]''. There are several poetic narrations of the story, the most famous being 'Heer' by [[Waris Shah]] written in 1766. It tells the story of the love of Heer and her lover Ranjha.<ref>http://apnaorg.com/research-papers/english/paper-9/page-1.shtml, Heer Ranjha, research paper on epic poem written by Waris Shah in 1766 on Academy of the Punjab in North America website, Retrieved 1 March 2016</ref>
[[File:Mahi Heer Tomb, Jhang, Punjab.jpg|thumb|right|250px|[[Heer and Ranjha's Tomb|Heer Ranjha's Grave]] in [[Jhang]]]]
==History== [[File:Heer Ranjha's tombstone.jpg|thumb|250px|Heer Ranjha's tombstone]]
''Heer Ranjha'' was written by Waris Shah. Some historians say that the story was the original work of Shah, written after he had fallen in love with a girl named Bhag Bhari.<ref name="hanif">{{citation|title=Biographical Encyclopaedia of Sufis: South Asia|author=N. Hanif|page=387|year=2000}}</ref> Others say that Heer and Ranjha were real personalities who lived under the [[Lodi dynasty]] and that Waris Shah later utilised these personalities for his story. Shah states that the story has a deeper meaning, referring to the unrelenting quest that man has towards God.<ref name="pirzada">{{citation|title=Chasing Love Up against the Sun|page=12|author=Waqar Pirzada|year=2014}}</ref>
==Example from the epic poem== Rag Heer Ranjha. The invocation at the beginning,<ref>In Waris Shah's version there is an added invocation to the famous [[Panj peer]] or five saints</ref> in one version:
:Awal-akhir naam Allah da lena, duja dos Muhammad Miran :Tija naun maat pita da lena, unha da chunga dudh sariran :Chautha naun unn paani da lena, jis khaave man banhe dhiran :Panjman naun Dharti Maata da lena, jis par kadam takiman :Chhewan naun Khwaja Pir da lena, jhul pilave thande niran :Satwan naun Guru Gorakhnath de lena, pataal puje bhojan :Athwan naun lalaanwale da lena, bande bande de tabaq zanjiran
:First take the name of Allah and second the Great Muhammad, the prophet [of God] :Third, take the name of father and mother, on whose milk my body thrived :Fourth, take the name of bread and water, by eating which my heart is gladdened :Fifth, take the name of Mother Earth, on whom I place my feet. :Sixth, take the name of Khwaja (Khizr, the Saint), who gives me cold water to drink :Seventh, take the name of Guru Gorakh Nath who is worshipped with a platter of milk and rice :Eighth, take the name of Lalanwala who breaks the bonds and the chains of captives
(The Legends of the Panjab by RC Temple, Rupa and Company, Volume two, page 606)
==Summary of the love story== [[File:Luddan ferries Ranjha across the Chenab.jpg|left|thumb|Luddan ferries Ranjha across the Chenab]] Heer is an extremely beautiful woman, born into a wealthy family of the [[Sial tribe]] in [[Jhang]] which is now [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]], Pakistan. Ranjha (whose first name is Dheedo; Ranjha is the surname,his caste is Ranjha[Jatt]), a Jat of the [[Ranjha (tribe)|Ranjha]] tribe, is the youngest of four brothers and lives in the village of [[Takht Hazara]] by the river [[Chenab]]. Being his father's favorite son, unlike his brothers who had to toil in the lands, he led a life of ease, playing the flute ('Wanjhli'/'[[Bansuri]]'). After a quarrel with his brothers over land, Ranjha leaves home. In Waris Shah's version of the epic, it is said that Ranjha left his home because his brothers' wives refused to give him food. Eventually he arrives in Heer's village and falls in love with her. Heer's father offers Ranjha a job herding his cattle. Heer becomes mesmerised by the way Ranjha plays his flute and eventually falls in love with him. They meet each other secretly for many years until they are caught by Heer's jealous uncle, Kaido, and her parents Chuchak and Malki. Heer is forced by her family and the local priest or '[[Maulvi]]' to marry another man named Saida Khera.
Ranjha is heartbroken. He wanders the countryside alone, until eventually he meets a [[Shaivism|Shaiva]] [[Jogi]] (ascetic). After meeting [[Gorakhnath]], the founder of the "Kanphata" (pierced ear) sect of jogis at [[Tilla Jogian]] (the 'Hill of Ascetics', located 50 miles north of the historic town of [[Bhera]], [[Sargodha District]], Punjab), Ranjha becomes a jogi himself, piercing his ears and renouncing the material world. While reciting the name of the Lord, he wanders all over Punjab, eventually finding the village where Heer now lives.
The two return to Heer's village, where Heer's parents agree to their marriage - though some versions of the story state that the parent's agreement is only a deception. On the wedding day, Kaido poisons her food so that the wedding will not take place, in order to punish the girl for her behaviour. Hearing this news, Ranjha rushes to aid Heer, but is too late, as she has already eaten the poison and has died. Brokenhearted once again, Ranjha eats the remaining poisoned ''[[Laddu]]'' (sweet) which Heer has eaten and dies by her side.
Heer and Ranjha are buried in Heer's hometown, Jhang. Love-smitten couples and others often pay visits to their mausoleum.<ref>Tomb of Heer Ranjha in Jhang.Pakistan Geotagging website link:http://pakgeotagging.blogspot.com/2014/05/tomb-of-heer-ranjha-in-jhang-takht.html, Retrieved 1 March 2016</ref> ==Legacy and influence== Because its plot involves a romance opposed by family members and ends with the two lovers dying, the story is often compared to the [[William Shakespeare|Shakespeare]] play ''[[Romeo and Juliet]]''.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Sirhandi|first=Marcella C.|date=1999-09-01|title=Manipulating Cultural Idioms|url=http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/00043249.1999.10791952|journal=Art Journal|volume=58|issue=3|pages=40–47|doi=10.1080/00043249.1999.10791952|issn=0004-3249}}</ref><ref>http://calhoun.nps.edu/bitstream/handle/10945/27353/689057.pdf?sequence=1</ref>
==In popular culture== The epic poem has been made into several feature films between 1928 and 2013.<ref>http://www.citwf.com/listFilms.asp?filmName=Heer+Ranjha, List of many films made on the love story of Heer Ranjha on Complete Index To World Film website, Retrieved 1 March 2016</ref>

In 2013, the television serial ''[[Heer Ranjha (TV series)|Heer Ranjha]]'', directed by Shahid Zahoor and produced by [[Yousuf Salahuddin]], aired on [[PTV Home]].{{citation needed|date=July 2016}}
==In music== The British musician [[Panjabi MC]] references the tale of Heer and Ranjha in his 2003 song ''[[Jogi (Panjabi MC song)|Jogi]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://lyricstranslate.com/en/jogi-ascetic.html|title=jogi lyrics + English translation|website=lyricstranslate.com|access-date=2016-10-27}}</ref> It has been sung by various Pakistani singers, including the classical/traditional artist [[Ghulam Ali (singer)|Ghulam Ali]].
The tale is mentioned in popular Bollywood songs such as "Ranjha" by Rupesh Kumar Ram from the movie ''[[Queen (soundtrack)|Queen]]'' ,"Ranjha Ranjha" by [[Rekha Bhardwaj]] and [[Javed Ali]] from the movie ''[[Raavan (soundtrack)|Raavan]]'' and "Dariya" from the movie ''Baar Baar Dekho''.{{cn|date=October 2018}}
The names of Heer and Ranjha have been referred in the song lyrics of "One Love: The Taj Anthem" by [[A.R.Rahman]].{{cn|date=October 2018}}
Alam Lohar is renowned for reciting Heer in various styles and one of the first international folk singers to bring this story in a song format.{{cn|date=October 2018}}
One of the songs of ''[[Jab Tak Hain Jaan]]'' (a film starring [[Shahrukh Khan]],[[Katrina Kaif]]) has been named "Heer".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.news18.com/news/india/jab-tak-hai-jaan-watch-the-new-song-heer-520366.html |publisher=News18 |title=Jab Tak Hai Jaan: Watch the new song 'Heer' |date=6 November 2012 |accessdate=9 October 2018}}</ref>

film aims for October release- Entertainment News, Firstpost|publisher=}} and ended in 40 working days.{{Cite news|url=https://www.thehindu.com/entertainment/movies/kaatrin-mozhi-varma-raining-remakes-in-kollywood/article24643041.ece|title=It’s raining remakes in Kollywood|last=Pillai|first=Sreedhar|date=2018-08-09|work=The Hindu|access-date=2018-08-14|language=en-IN|issn=0971-751X}} The first look poster which was revealed by Jyothika's husband [[Suriya]] on Independence Day and features her carrying a placard with "Ten Commandments for Women", and was seen as a satirical comment at the "restrictions" placed on women by society.{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/tamil/kaatrin-mozhi-first-look-independence-day-jyothika-5307439/|title=Kaatrin Mozhi first look: On Independence Day, Jyothika gives ten commandments for women|date=15 August 2018|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/regional-movies/kaatrin-mozhi-first-look-jyothika-introduces-10-commandments-for-women-impresses-fans-see-pic/story-szeKKWpnzi1YfN8pKxZaDN.html|title=Kaatrin Mozhi first look: Jyothika introduces 10 commandments for women, impresses fans. See pic|date=15 August 2018|publisher=}} Kaatrin Mozhi new stills showing Jyothika in an unembellished avatar, playing with a pet pigeon released revealing her Character along with its release date as October 18.{{cite web|url=https://www.firstpost.com/entertainment/kaatrin-mozhi-new-stills-show-jyothika-in-an-unembellished-avatar-playing-with-a-pet-pigeon-5016031.html|title=Kaatrin Mozhi new stills show Jyothika in an unembellished avatar, playing with a pet pigeon- Entertainment News, Firstpost|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/regional-cinema/story/jyothika-rj-look-in-radha-mohan-kaatrin-mozhi-1322651-2018-08-24|title=Kaatrin Mozhi poster: Jyothika reminds of Vidya Balan from Tumhari Sulu|website=India Today}} ==Release== The film released worldwide on 16th November.The film didnt fare well in box office since the makers planned its release during sarkar release.Also the recent controversies by actor shivkumar made many people boycott the film.Jyothika is the daughter in law of shivakumar. ==Critical response== Times of India has given 3.5 stars and summarized "This remake of Tumhari Sulur is an engaging entertainer that manages to retain the spirit of the original"{{Citation|title=Kaatrin Mozhi Review {3.5/5}: Vidya Balan starrer is an engaging entertainer|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movie-reviews/kaatrin-mozhi/movie-review/66642775.cms|access-date=2018-11-17}}. Behindwoods said "Jyothika and Radhamohan are back with a neatly made feel good drama that you can watch with your family".{{Cite web|url=https://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies/kaatrin-mozhi/kaatrin-mozhi-review.html|title=Kaatrin Mozhi (aka) Katrin Mozhi review|website=Behindwoods|access-date=2018-11-17}} Film companion said "This remake could have used better craft and performances, but the core still works".{{Cite news|url=https://www.filmcompanion.in/kaatrin-mozhi-movie-review-jyothika-vidharth-lakshmi-manchu/|title=Kaatrin Mozhi Movie Review: This Remake Could Have Used Better Craft And Performances, But The Core Still Works|date=2018-11-16|work=Film Companion|access-date=2018-11-17|language=en-US}} == Soundtrack == {{Infobox album |name = Kaatrin Mozhi |type = Soundtrack |artist = A.H. page.title: List of authors banned in Nazi Germany

revision.comment: [[File:Bebelplatz Night of Shame Monument.jpg|thumb|right|A memorial on [[Bebelplatz]], site of a Nazi book burning in May 1933. Empty shelves are visible through a window in the pavement.]]
revision.text:
[[File:Bebelplatz Night of Shame Monument.jpg|thumb|right|A memorial on [[Bebelplatz]], site of a Nazi book burning in May 1933. Empty shelves are visible through a window in the pavement.]] This list includes both authors whose entire literary production was officially banned in [[Nazi Germany]] and authors who were only partially banned.<ref>[https://verbrannte-und-verbannte.de/person?person=all&sort=name%3Aasc ''Verbrannte und verbannte'']</ref> These authors are from the prohibitions lists in Nazi Germany and come from the following lists and others: # List of damaging and undesirable writing, ''Liste des schädlichen und unerwünschten Schrifttums'', December 31, 1938 # ''Jahreslisten 1939-1941''. Unchanged new printing of the Leipzig edition, 1938-1941, Vaduz 1979
The official list was published by the ''[[Ministry of Public Enlightenment and Propaganda|Reichsministerium für Volksaufklärung und Propaganda]]''. Authors, living and dead, were placed on the list because of [[Judaism|Jewish]] descent, or because of [[pacifism|pacifist]] or [[communism|communist]] sympathies or suspicion thereof.
In May and June 1933, in the first year of the Nazi government, there were [[Nazi book burnings|book burning]]s. These book bans compose a part of the history of [[censorship]] and a subset of the [[list of banned books]].
After [[World War II]] started, Germans created indexes of prohibited books in countries they occupied, of works in languages other than German. For example, in [[Occupation of Poland (1939–1945)|occupied Poland]], an index of 1,500 prohibited authors was created.<ref>Czesław Madajczyk, ''Polityka III Rzeszy w okupowanej Polsce, Tom II'' (Politics of the Third Reich in Occupied Poland, Part Two), Państwowe Wydawnictwo Naukowe, 1970, p.125</ref>

[[File:Chamangá.JPG|thumb|300px|Chamangá.]] The '''Chamangá Rock Art Place''' ({{lang-es|'''Localidad Rupestre de Chamangá'''}}) is a concentration of [[rock painting]] located at [[Chamangá]] to the east of [[Trinidad, Uruguay]]. <!-- == Generalidades == Se trata de una extensión de más de 12.000 hectáreas caracterizadas por un relieve suavemente ondulado y ecosistemas de praderas -con suelos de alta fertilidad dedicados a la explotación agrícola ganadera extensiva- con montes asociados a los arroyos [[arroyo Chamangá|Chamangá]] y [[arroyo Los Molles|Los Molles]] y con algunos [[bañado]]s.
Presenta la mayor concentración de [[pictografías rupestres]] del Uruguay, cuya singularidad está dada por su emplazamiento en campos abiertos y sobre afloramientos [[graníticos]].<ref>{{cita web |url=http://www.lr21.com.uy/comunidad/322598-chamanga-pinturas-rupestres-de-flores-son-propuestas-como-area-protegida |título=Chamangá propuesta como área protegida |fechaacceso=22 de abril |añoacceso=2012 |apellido= |nombre= |fecha=31-7-2008 |obra=LR21 |idioma= |cita= }}</ref> Se trata de 43 pictografías rupestres caracterizadas por sus trazos y formas geométricas abstractas y son de color rojo por la base mineral del pigmento, la [[hematita]]. El Centro de Investigación del Arte Rupestre en Uruguay las ha analizado: se trata de impresiones de palma de mano en positivo, tanto adultas como juveniles; trazos de grosor digital; trazos realizados con pincel fino de dos tipos, rígido y flexible; y "grabado fino", incisión realizada con instrumento cortante agudo, se da en su tipo geométrico irregular "destructivo".<ref>[http://www.flores.org.uy/cultura/arterupe.htm CIARU]</ref> Estas pinturas presentan relación con una tendencia estilística muy desarrollada en la [[Patagonia]] andina y no andina, que abarca también la región pampeana, y se asemejan al 'estilo grecas' o simétrico complejo. Es un estilo de pintura, básicamente, en rojo, siempre con diseños de tipo geométrico abstracto, sumamente difundido. La antiguedad es entre los 1.000 a 1.500 años antes del presente;<ref>[http://www.uypress.net/uc_2740_1.html Análisis de las pinturas rupestres de Chamangá]</ref> si bien hay quienes, como el Lic. Andrés Florines, les atribuyen una antigüedad de hasta 3.000 años. Hay catalogadas 41 pinturas que los investigadores denominan como POCH (Porongos-Chamangá) y que son conocidas cariñosamente como "las pochas".<ref>{{cita web |url=http://www.elpais.com.uy/Suple/LaSemanaEnElPais/05/11/25/lasem_ciud_186888.asp |título=Arte rupestre de Chamangá |fechaacceso=22 de abril |añoacceso=2012 |apellido= |nombre= |fecha=25-11-2005 |obra=EL PAIS |idioma= |cita= }}</ref>
En 1992 fueron declarados Monumento Histórico Nacional.<ref>[http://www.patrimonioyturismoflores.org/patrimonio-y-turismo/46-chamanga.html Chamangá]</ref> A partir de la aprobación del correspondiente Decreto se inicia el proceso de elaboración del “Plan de Manejo” definiendo las pautas y planes generales correspondientes al área (art. 12, Ley Nº 17.234), etapa en la que se convocará a participar a los actores involucrados, ahora en el marco de constituir la futura Comisión Asesora Específica de Localidad Rupestre de Chamangá.
La Localidad Rupestre de Chamangá aguarda ser integrada al Sistema Nacional de Áreas Protegidas (SNAP) bajo la categoría Paisaje Protegido.<ref>{{cita web |url=http://archivo.presidencia.gub.uy/_Web/noticias/2009/10/2009101201.htm |título=Expertos recorren Chamangá |fechaacceso=22 de abril |añoacceso=2012 |apellido= |nombre= |fecha=12-10-2009 |obra=Presidencia de la República |idioma= |cita= }}</ref> El área cuenta con valores naturales y culturales incluyendo pinturas rupestres y restos arqueológicos prehistóricos, que han sido objeto de estudios académicos e investigaciones científicas. El sitio ya contaba con una declaración de interés departamental para su estudio, investigación y preservación desde setiembre de 1998.<ref>[http://www.ecosregionales.net/?edicion=1448&noticia=12343 Chamangá en el SNAP]</ref>
Mención aparte merece la gran diversidad biológica del lugar, con más de 100 especies de aves.<ref>[http://argentina.indymedia.org/news/2010/03/721182.php Localidad rupestre de Chamangá, lienzo de aborígenes uruguayos]</ref> -->

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2015}} {{Use British English|date=July 2015}} {{Infobox Architectural Practice |image= Lighthouse_glasgow_spiral_staircase.jpg |caption= The Lighthouse, Glasgow |name= Page \ Park Architects |architects= David Page Brian Park
|founded=1981 |location_city = [[Glasgow]] |location_country = Scotland |significant_buildings=[[The Lighthouse (Glasgow)]] |awards= 2006 [[RIAS Andrew Doolan Award for Architecture]] |homepage = [http://www.pagepark.co.uk http://www.pagepark.co.uk]}}
'''Page\Park Architects''' was established in 1981<ref>{{cite web |url=http://glasgowsculpture.com/pg_biography.php?sub=page_park |title=Page Park Architects Biography |publisher=Glasgow City of Sculpture}}</ref> by David Page and Brian Park and has developed as one of Scotland’s best known practices undertaking work over a range of sectors.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.scottisharchitects.org.uk/architect_full.php?id=402920 |title=Page\Park Biography |publisher=Scottish Architects.org.uk}}</ref>
With over 150 national and international design awards since its inception in 1981, Page\Park has won the [[Carbon Trust]] Award in Scotland twice, and has been shortlisted for the [[RIAS Andrew Doolan Award for Architecture]] four times, winning once in 2006 for the Maggie's Centre Highlands and receiving a Special Commendation in 2010 for the McManus Galleries.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bdonline.co.uk/news/elder-and-cannon-scoops-the-doolan-prize/5009358.article |title=Elder & Cannon scoops the Doolan prize |publisher=Building Design Magazine |date=22 November 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.scotsman.com/scotland/Ultramodern-office-for-housing-group.6633177.jp |title=Ultra-modern office for housing group is Scotland's best building |publisher=The Scosman |date=20 November 2010 |location=Edinburgh |first=Brian |last=Ferguson}}</ref>
In 2005, the [[Scotland|Scottish]] [[architecture]] magazine [[Prospect (architecture magazine)|''Prospect'']] published a [[Prospect 100 best modern Scottish buildings|list of the 100 best modern Scottish buildings]], as voted for by its readers, which featured six Page\Park projects.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.scotsman.com/scotland/Revealed-top-100-modern-Scots.2666190.jp |title=AJ100 |publisher=The Architects' Journal |year=2010 |location=Edinburgh |first=Jeremy |last=Watson}}</ref>
In 2010, Page\Park were 93rd in the [[Architects Journal]] top 100 architectural practices in the [[United Kingdom]]. In 2014 they had risen to 71 and had won the AJ100 Best Place to Work Award 2014. In December 2013 They became an employee owned business.
==Notable Projects==
===Completed Projects===
*[[The Lighthouse (Glasgow)|The Lighthouse]], Glasgow, Scotland *Maggie's Centre, Inverness, Scotland *Maggie's Centre, Glasgow, Scotland *[[National Museum of Rural Life]] *Rowardennan Field station, Scotland *Aqualibrium Campbeltown, Kintyre, Scotland *Gorbals housing, Glasgow, Scotland *[[Eden Court Theatre]], Inverness, Scotland *[[Carnegie United Kingdom Trust]] Headquarters, Scotland *1967-1969 Dumbarton Road, Glasgow, Scotland *Fettes Prep School, Edinburgh, Scotland *Loch Lomond and the Trossachs Headquarters, Scotland *Fraser Building, Glasgow, Scotland *[[Linburn Centre]], Wilkieston, West Lothian *[[McManus Galleries]], Dundee *Bluebell Views Student Residences, University of Warwick, England *[[Rosslyn Chapel]], Scotland *Olympia Theatre, Bridgeton, Scotland
===Ongoing and Future Projects===
*Theatre Royal Extension, Glasgow *Scottish Power Headquarters, Glasgow *Kelvin Hall Redevelopment, Glasgow *Laurieston Housing Development, Glasgow *Refurbishment of the David Hume Tower, Edinburgh
